titleStmt.title: Despatch from John H. Smyth to William M. Evarts, April 4, 1881

bibl.title: Despatch from John H. Smyth to William M. Evarts
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p:
Consulate General of the United States,
Monrovia, Liberia, Apr. 4, 1881.

Mr. Jno. H. Smyth to the
Secretary of State.
Quarterly returns to the Department of State, & to the Fifth Auditor of the Treasury quarterly accounts.

Consulate General of the United States,
Monrovia, Liberia, April 4, 1881.
I have the honor respectfully to submit my reports for the third quarter ending, Mar. 31st, 1881.
You will observe that there is no digest of the invoice book, due to the absence of any reported exportation to the United States during this quarter.
A new house, Messrs. Fowler, Crampton & Co. of New York entered upon the Liberian trade this year, and their vessel the "Tuck Sing" arrived in the harbor of Monrovia, January 1st, 1881.

While
Hon. W. M. Evarts,
Secretary of State,
Washington, D.C.
While this firm has had correspondents here for some time, and has been the depositary of from fifteen to twenty thousand dollars of Liberians, it has never before sent a vessel out. The reported failure of the firm has caused much alarm here, but up to this time no reliable data as to the failure has reached this legation or consulate general.

Please find enclosed for the Department the following: despatches received, No. 1; despatches & letters sent, No. 2; arrivals and departures of American vessels, No. 3; and returns & accounts to the Fifth Auditor of the Treasury, record of Treasury fees, No. 1; fees received on account of vessels, No. 1, fees not contained in form No. 103, No. 2; salary account, with abstract of contingent expenses, & certificate of now absence, No 3.

I am, Sir, Your obd't serv't
serv't,
Jno. H. Smyth, U.S. Consul Gen'l

1 Despatches received.
2 Despatches & letters sent.
3 Arrivals & departures of American vessels.

1 Record of Treasury fees.
1 Fees received on account of vessels.
2 Fees not contained in form No. 103.
3 Salary account, with abstract of contingent expenses & vouchers; certificate of now absence.
